Operation 'delete_/webhooks/{webhook_id}' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description explains the action but lacks clarity on response format and explicit confirmation of the side effect (cessation of all events). Added response status code, authentication requirement, and explicit statement about event delivery cessation to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's complete effect.

data.current_description:
Delete a webhook so that events are not sent to the specified URL any more.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a webhook subscription by its ID, immediately stopping all event notifications to the associated URL. Requires the webhook_id path parameter and authentication. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. After deletion, no further order or payment lifecycle events will be sent to the previously configured endpoint.
data.reasoning: The current description explains the action but lacks clarity on response format and explicit confirmation of the side effect (cessation of all events). Added response status code, authentication requirement, and explicit statement about event delivery cessation to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's complete effect.

message: Operation 'get_/webhooks' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. The current description is clear about the action but lacks details about the response structure and practical use cases. Added information about response format (array of Webhook objects), what fields are included, and when an AI agent should use this operation (e.g., before creating/updating webhooks) to improve interpretability.

data.current_description:
Get a list of webhooks that the partner is currently subscribed to.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all webhooks currently configured for the authenticated partner. Returns an array of Webhook objects containing subscription details including event types, target URLs, and configuration status. Requires authentication. Use this operation to audit existing webhook subscriptions before creating or updating webhooks.
data.reasoning: The current description is clear about the action but lacks details about the response structure and practical use cases. Added information about response format (array of Webhook objects), what fields are included, and when an AI agent should use this operation (e.g., before creating/updating webhooks) to improve interpretability.

message: Operation 'post_/webhooks' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. The current description lacks specificity about required inputs and response details. Added information about the request schema (WebhookCreateRequest), what must be specified (URL and event types), response status code, response structure (Webhook object with webhook_id), and when event delivery begins. This enables AI agents to understand what parameters are needed and what to expect in the response.

data.current_description:
Create a webhook so that Ramp can push event notifications to the specified URL.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new webhook subscription to receive event notifications from Ramp. Requires a WebhookCreateRequest body specifying the target URL and event types to subscribe to. Returns a 200 response with the created Webhook object including the webhook_id, configuration details, and subscription status. Requires authentication. The webhook will immediately begin receiving events matching the configured event types.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks specificity about required inputs and response details. Added information about the request schema (WebhookCreateRequest), what must be specified (URL and event types), response status code, response structure (Webhook object with webhook_id), and when event delivery begins. This enables AI agents to understand what parameters are needed and what to expect in the response.

message: Operation 'get_/buy' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Retrieve a redirect URL' is too generic and doesn't convey the specific action (generating a purchase redirect). Description lacks clarity about the return type (RampRedirectUrl object) and doesn't clearly state this is for initiating purchases. Improved summary specifies the action and context. Enhanced description clarifies the return value, use case, and important formatting detail about minor currency units for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
Retrieve a redirect URL to the Ramp app widget for provided buy parameters. Use it to redirect the customer to Revolut Ramp to make the purchase.
 
:::note
The `fiatAmount` in the Redirect URL is provided in minor currency units. For example, GBP 12.00 is represented as `1200`.
:::

For more information, see the guides: [Leverage the Crypto Ramp API -> Get a Revolut Ramp Redirect URL](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/use-the-api#get-a-revolut-ramp-redirect-url).
data.summary_suggestion: Generate Ramp widget redirect URL for purchase
data.description_suggestion: Generate a redirect URL to the Revolut Ramp app widget for initiating a cryptocurrency purchase with specified parameters. Returns a RampRedirectUrl object containing the widget URL. Use this URL to redirect customers to complete their fiat-to-crypto purchase. Note: fiatAmount values in the URL are in minor currency units (e.g., GBP 12.00 = 1200).
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Retrieve a redirect URL' is too generic and doesn't convey the specific action (generating a purchase redirect). Description lacks clarity about the return type (RampRedirectUrl object) and doesn't clearly state this is for initiating purchases. Improved summary specifies the action and context. Enhanced description clarifies the return value, use case, and important formatting detail about minor currency units for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'get_/orders' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Original summary 'Retrieve all orders' is misleading as the operation requires date range filtering, not truly 'all' orders. Description lacks clarity about required input parameters (date range) and return type (array of Order objects). Improved summary clarifies the filtering requirement. Enhanced description specifies the required inputs, sorting behavior, and return type for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Retrieve all orders by date range.

The results are sorted chronologically by the `created_at` date (i.e. oldest first).

For more information, see the guides: [Leverage the Crypto Ramp API -> Get all orders](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/use-the-api#get-all-orders).
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve orders filtered by date range
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve all cryptocurrency purchase orders filtered by a specified date range. Results are sorted chronologically by creation date (oldest first). Requires date range parameters to filter orders. Returns an array of Order objects representing fiat-to-crypto exchange transactions.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Retrieve all orders' is misleading as the operation requires date range filtering, not truly 'all' orders. Description lacks clarity about required input parameters (date range) and return type (array of Order objects). Improved summary clarifies the filtering requirement. Enhanced description specifies the required inputs, sorting behavior, and return type for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'get_/webhooks/{webhook_id}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate and action-oriented. Description is too vague ('Get the details') and lacks specificity about what details are returned (Webhook object with URL, event types, configuration). data.current_description:
Get the details of a specific webhook.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the configuration details of a specific webhook by webhook_id. Returns a Webhook object containing the webhook's URL, event types, and other configuration settings. Use this to verify webhook settings or retrieve webhook information for management purposes.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate and action-oriented. Description is too vague ('Get the details') and lacks specificity about what details are returned (Webhook object with URL, event types, configuration). Enhanced description clarifies the return type, what information is included, and the use case for better AI agent understanding of the operation's purpose and output.

message: Operation 'patch_/webhooks/{webhook_id}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate. Description is too vague and lacks critical details: what can be updated (URL, event types), what input is expected (WebhookUpdateRequest), what is returned (updated Webhook object), whether partial updates are supported, and side effects (changes take effect immediately). data.current_description:
Update the details of a specific webhook.

For more information, see the guides: [Work with webhooks -> Track order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/crypto-ramp/guides/buy-crypto/tutorials/work-with-webhooks/use-webhooks).
data.description_suggestion: Update the configuration of a specific webhook identified by webhook_id. Accepts a WebhookUpdateRequest containing updatable fields such as URL and event types. Returns the updated Webhook object with new configuration. Supports partial updates - only provided fields will be modified. Changes take effect immediately for tracking order and payment lifecycle events.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate.
